record.title: ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, MAY 2, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, May 2; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with the first half controlled by the majority and the final portion under the control of the Republicans; that at the close of morning business the Senate then resume consideration of S. 1082, and the mandatory quorum call under rule XXII be waived.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
